source.video_title: "Stupid Simple" Apps Are Making Millions While You Overthink

idea: Give away a best-in-class CRM for a specific vertical (dentists, chiropractors, barbers) for FREE, and monetize through white-labeled credit card processing, payroll, and health insurance services.

problem.pain: Small business owners pay $100-500/month for generic CRMs that aren't built for their industry, plus multiple vendors for payments, payroll, insurance
problem.who_has_it: Solo practitioners and small service businesses: dentists, chiropractors, barbers, HVAC, plumbers
problem.current_solution: Pay for generic CRM + separate payment processor + separate payroll + separate insurance, or manage manually

value_prop: Your entire business operating system — CRM, scheduling, invoicing, payments — for $0/month. We make money when you make money.

mvp.description: Industry-specific CRM (white-label Go High Level), appointment scheduling, client communication, invoicing + payment collection via white-labeled processor
mvp.success_metric: 10 paying merchants processing $50K+/month within 90 days = $5K/month revenue at 1% margin

stories.i_want: sign up for a free CRM built for my industry
stories.so_that: I can manage my business without paying SaaS fees
acceptance_criteria: Connected to payment processor within setup

stories.so_that: I don't have to manage scheduling manually

stories.i_want: send invoices and collect payment in-app
stories.so_that: I get paid faster and everything is tracked
acceptance_criteria: Funds deposited to my bank account

stories.so_that: I earn margin on every transaction without building payments infrastructure
acceptance_criteria: Integrated white-label processor (Stripe Connect, Finix, etc.)

technical.likely_stack: Next.js + Supabase + Stripe Connect (or Go High Level white-label)
key_challenges: Payment processor onboarding — KYC/compliance for sub-merchants
dependencies: Go High Level agency account ($297-497/month) OR dev time for custom

risks.risk: Merchants don't want to switch payment processors
risks.mitigation: Target new businesses or those unhappy with current processor

risks.risk: Margins too thin to be profitable
risks.mitigation: Volume is key. Upsell payroll/insurance in Phase 2

tech_fit.notes: Perfect fit. GHL shortcut gets to market fast. Custom build has more upside but more work.

viability.reasoning: Model is proven (Squarespace, Toast do this). Main risk is sales — convincing merchants to switch processors. Key insight: compete on 'it's free' not features.
